title: Installation issue: jdk
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install jdk@11
==> Fetching http://download.oracle.com/otn-pub/java/jdk/11+13/19aef61b38124481863b1413dce1855f/jdk-11_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
##################################################################################################################################################################################################### 100.0%
==> Warning: The contents of the archive look like HTML. Either the URL you are trying to use does not exist or you have an internet gateway issue. You can remove the bad archive using 'spack clean <package>', then try again using the correct URL.
==> Staging archive: /opt/spack/var/spack/stage/jdk-11-oyuzfniqeymon2l5tgnsbwj5iscatb3v/jdk-11_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz

gzip: stdin: not in gzip format
/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/tar-1.31-ahrqlcrmdvdtia5b5j253tdwyezbbfqc/bin/tar: Child returned status 1
/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/tar-1.31-ahrqlcrmdvdtia5b5j253tdwyezbbfqc/bin/tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    '/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/tar-1.31-ahrqlcrmdvdtia5b5j253tdwyezbbfqc/bin/tar' '-xf' '/opt/spack/var/spack/stage/jdk-11-oyuzfniqeymon2l5tgnsbwj5iscatb3v/jdk-11_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz'
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux nessie 4.18.0-16-generic #17~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Feb 12 13:35:51 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS
``` 

### Additional information

The issue seems to be related to the process for accepting the Oracle Java licence - trying to do so using the same mechanism with either curl or wget fails as well.
